background: A school is organizing a field trip and requires buses of two sizes to transport students, with constraints on minimum students transported and parking limitations for the larger buses.
constraints: The number of small buses is non-negative
The number of large buses is non-negative
The total number of students transported must be at least MinStudents
The number of large buses cannot exceed MaxLargeBusProportion times the total number of buses
objective: Minimize the total number of buses needed
description: A school is organizing a field trip to a science center and wants to hire small buses (each with a capacity of \param{SmallBusCapacity} students) and large buses (each with a capacity of \param{LargeBusCapacity} students). The school needs to provide transportation for at least \param{MinStudents} students. In addition, since the parking lot is rather small, a maximum of \param{MaxLargeBusProportion} of the buses can be large buses. How many of each type of bus should be hired to minimize the total number of buses?

parameters.definition: Minimum number of students to be transported
